intro: Auriculardisia micrantha, commonly known as the small-lobed auriculardisia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive auriculate (ear-shaped) leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
